content: Persistent cloud cover kept temperatures on the low side today. In fact, D.C. just barely hit 50 degrees, the lowest high temperature since the end of February. Temperatures will struggle to hit the 50-degree mark again tomorrow, and some light showers are in… [+938 chars]
source.name: The Washington Post

author: Amy Gardner
title: Intensifying coronavirus fears rattle voters and elections officials in advance of Tuesday primaries
description: Hundreds of poll workers are expected not to show up amid worries about contracting the virus.
content: In Arizona, Florida, Illinois and Ohio, election officials have raced to replace poll workers who have said they will not show Tuesday, supply thousands of precincts with sanitizing supplies, and notify voters whose polling locations, many in senior facilitie… [+8416 chars]
source.name: The Washington Post

author: Loveday Morris
title: German officials to discuss reported U.S. attempt to buy exclusive rights to coronavirus vaccine
description: The German firm CureVac, which has been working to develop a coronavirus vaccine, denied the German newspaper report.
content:
Germanys Welt am Sonntag newspaper reported Sunday that the administration wanted to secure the rights and move research and development to the United States. The vaccine would be developed only for the USA, the newspaper said.
Merkel warns virus could infec… [+3615 chars]
source.name: The Washington Post

author: Ariana Eunjung Cha
title: Spiking U.S. coronavirus cases could force rationing decisions similar to those made in Italy, China - The Washington Post
description: In an extreme outbreak, rationing would raise tortured questions.  Should a patient with a terminal cancer or serious heart disease get the same priority as everyone else? Should the CEO of a hospital or a health worker be prioritized? How should prisoners or…
content:
And in northern Italy, doctors took the painful step last week of issuing guidelines for rationing ventilators and other essential medical equipment, prioritizing treatment for the young and others with the best chance of survival.

author: Cheryl Benard
description: Dulles Airport chaos: A case study in how not to handle a pandemic.

author: Josef Federman | AP
title: Israel takes step toward monitoring phones of virus patients
description: Israel's Cabinet has authorized the Shin Bet internal security agency to use mobile-phone tracking technology to monitor the movements of coronovirus patients, despite an outcry from privacy advocates
content:
Netanyahu announced his plan in a televised address late Saturday, telling the nation that the drastic steps would protect the publics health, though it would also entail a certain degree of violation of privacy.
